name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"c5dbf7c2-661d-426a-8a28-94dd35a4c023","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Class Documentation: ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ModuleManager","styles":{"code":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"77c391a4-015c-4981-819d-4064961aed38","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ModuleManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class serves as the central administrative registry for all Python modules encountered during analysis. It provides the necessary infrastructure to distinguish between the project's own source code (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"internal","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":") and third-party dependencies (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"external","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"). This distinction is vital for the analysis engine to decide when to perform deep inspection and when to treat a call as an opaque external dependency.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d79dd6cc-075c-40b5-b7a0-599e1f0cea45","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"cadf1aac-cf7c-4f56-a892-858cb9af599c","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Attributes","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6818b2d3-8bc4-42ae-b8eb-1c7e1ee56ae0","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"internal","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"dict","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): A mapping of module names to ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Module","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects that belong to the core project being analyzed.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4de81cf1-391e-4287-b2b6-e7fafa089178","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"external","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"dict","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): A mapping of module names to ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Module","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects representing third-party libraries (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"os","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"requests","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"adcf4c0c-5878-46e2-96fb-193a815b9824","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"local","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"set","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"): A collection of module namespaces identified as local to the current analysis context, used to prioritize local resolution over global imports.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"dab9463d-ed78-4487-87ee-89be0522c0a3","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"c620a7d5-62ab-4f70-84fc-2c256cdd6d5b","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Methods","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"b9c0c9a4-94e6-49ea-9a07-254431eb9cb1","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"__init__()
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Initializes the manager with empty registries and sets up the tracking environment for internal, external, and local modules.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a104ff0e-30ad-4ad9-b5cc-736c72566007","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"create(name, fname, external=False)
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Instantiates a new ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Module","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" object and automatically registers it in the appropriate category.","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"7ab3e1e4-b996-438a-82d3-6d10c174a327","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"name","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The fully qualified name of the module.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"258a585f-a124-498d-bc6d-f270746c054f","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"fname","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The file path to the module.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cda22168-5d3a-4510-9b4c-0635ab989953","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"external","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":": Boolean flag. If ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"True","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the module is added to the external registry.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"dece03ff-57e6-45e7-a6d6-b23b497afd71","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get(name)
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Retrieves a module from the registries. It searches the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"internal","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" map first, then the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"external","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" map.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9c2d7ad3-5250-4ebd-bea5-c5bc2ed3ba8c","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_func_name(moduleNs, funcName)
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"A convenience method to jump directly to a function or method's metadata within a specific module.","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"7f1d9db2-63ae-4c74-80ab-b6b62348473c","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Returns the function data (like line numbers) if found in the specified module.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"3930849a-9577-403d-8e95-b32647f89c3e","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"get_internal_modules()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" / ","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"get_external_modules()
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Return the respective dictionaries for bulk processing or inspection.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"eae290a1-ba7b-4f39-b4a7-c9879f3d8d06","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"add_local_modules(moduleNs)","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" / ","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"get_local_modules()
","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Manage the "Local" set. These methods help the analyzer understand which namespaces are defined within the current project's working directory.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cd019d78-417d-4505-ab89-8e380d473dec","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"f038e1bb-ec3c-4eeb-8e1a-785dccaa93b0","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Usage Example","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d4027516-9452-48af-88f6-736a029c12d5","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ModuleManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is typically populated during the project's initial discovery phase.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"296984f8-8023-47e2-8b3a-ada937202c98","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"# 1. Initialize the manager
mm = ModuleManager()

# 2. Register an internal project module
mm.create("app.auth", "/src/app/auth.py", external=False)
mm.add_local_modules("app.auth")

# 3. Register an external dependency
mm.create("flask", "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/flask/__init__.py", external=True)

# 4. Lookup a module to inspect its properties
auth_mod = mm.get("app.auth")
if auth_mod:
    print(f"Module found at: {auth_mod.fname}")

# 5. Check if a function exists in a module
func_data = mm.get_func_name("app.auth", "login")","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6b8f4614-3145-44cf-964e-c036df30392b","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Insights","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cff017d4-c556-4113-88ee-042be959d187","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Boundary Awareness","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": By separating modules into ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"internal","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"external","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", Jarvis can avoid "analysis paralysis"—it can focus its computational resources on the project's logic while simply acknowledging calls to external libraries.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"83d5fcda-6979-499a-b1d7-4609e8ca0825","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Search Priority","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method prioritizes ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"internal","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" modules. This mirrors Python's own import resolution behavior where local files often shadow global libraries.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"97dec27b-b232-49a6-a696-f1f98f95167d","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Metadata Hub","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":": Through the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_func_name","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" method, this class acts as a gateway to the specific metadata (like line ranges) stored within individual ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Module","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" objects, facilitating rapid source code navigation.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f665c624-935f-4a5c-9431-12d5d4ea04ed","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
